description: Write 0,1,2,... in clockwise spiral, writing each digit in separate square; sequence gives numbers on negative x axis.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = A033307(4*n^2-n-1) for n > 0. [Andrew Woods, May 20 2012]
example: ..1-3-1-4-1....|.......|....2.4-5-6.5....|.|...|.|....1.3.0.7.1....|.|.|.|.|....1.2-1.8.6....|.....|.|....1-0-1-9.1..We begin with the 0 and wrap the numbers 1 2 3 4 ... around it. Then the sequence is obtained by reading leftwards, starting from the initial 0. - _Andrew Woods_, May 20 2012
prog: (Haskell)a033989 0 = 0a033989 n = a033307 $ a185950 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 14 2013
crossrefs: Sequences based on the same spiral: A033953, A033988, A033990. Spiral without zero: A033952.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from Andrew J. Gacek (andrew(AT)dgi.net)
Edited by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 01 2009
